src: Gröönimaa oli hõredalt asustatud. Muinasskandinaavia saagade kohaselt saadeti Erik Punane mõrva eest Islandilt pagendusse ning kui ta kaugemale läände reisis, avastas ta Gröönimaa ja pani sellele nime. Hoolimata tema avastusest, elasid seal sel ajal juba eskimohõimud. Ehkki iga riik oli skandinaavialik, leidus Taani, Rootsi, Norra ja Islandi rahva, kuningate, tavade ning ajaloo vahel palju erinevusi.
mt: Greenland was sparsely populated. According to the sagas of the Norsemen, Erik the Red was exiled to Iceland for murder and, when he sailed further west, he discovered Greenland and named it. Despite his discovery, Eskimo tribes already lived there. Although each country was Scandinavian, the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland differed greatly.
ref: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland. But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time. Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.

src: Samas kui suurem osa nende toidust oleks meile tuttav, oli roomlastel oma osa imelikke või ebatavalisi hõrgutisi, sh metssiga, paabulind, teod ja üks näriline nimega unihiir. Teine erinevus oli see, et kuigi vaesed inimesed ja naised sõid toolidel istudes, siis rikastele meestele meeldisid pidusöögid, kus nad sõid külitavas asendis puhates. Vana-Rooma toidud ei saanud sisaldada toiduaineid, mis tulid Euroopasse Ameerikast või Aasiast hilisematel sajanditel. Näiteks ei olnud neil maisi, tomateid, kartuleid ega kakaod, ning mitte ükski roomlane ei maitsnud kunagi kalkunit.
mt: While most of their food would have been familiar to us, the Romans had their own share of strange or unusual delicacies, such as wild boar, peacock, dormice and one called the dormouse. Another difference was that while poor people and women ate sitting at a table, the rich men preferred banquets where they ate reclining on couches. Roman food could not contain foodstuffs that came to Europe from America or Asia in later centuries. For example, they did not have maize, tomatoes, potatoes or cocoa, and no Roman ever tasted chocolate.
ref: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals. Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries. For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.

src: Tsivilisatsioon on üksainus kultuur, mida jagab märkimisväärselt suur rühm koos elavaid ja töötavaid inimesi ehk ühiskond. Sõna tsivilisatsioon tuleb ladinakeelsest sõnast civilis, mis tähendab „kodaniku-”, mis on seotud ladina sõnadega civis, „kodanik”, ja civitas, mis tähendab „linna või linnriiki”, ning see määratleb mingil määral ka ühiskonna suuruse. Linnriigid on riikide eelkäijad. Tsivilisatsiooniline kultuur tähendab teadmiste edasiandmist mitme põlvkonna vältel, püsivat kultuurilist jalajälge ja piisavat kultuurilevi. Väiksemad kultuurid kaovad tihti asjakohaseid ajaloolisi tõendeid jätmata ja neid ei tunnustata tõeliste tsivilisatsioonidena.
mt: Civilisation is the only culture shared by a significant number of living and working people, i.e. a society. The word civilisation comes from the Latin word civilis, which means "citizen", and is related to the Latin words civis, "citizen", and civitas, which means "city or state", and it defines the size of society to some extent. City-states are precursors of states. Civilisational culture means the transmission of knowledge over several generations, a persistent cultural footprint, and sufficient cultural spread. Smaller cultures often lose relevant historical evidence and are not recognised as true civilisations.
ref: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society. The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society. City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination. Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.

src: Drukgyal Dzong on varemetes kindlus ja budismi klooster Paro piirkonna ülaosas (Phondey külas). Öeldakse, et 1649. aastal lõi Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel kindluse selleks, et tähistada oma võitu Tiibeti-Mongoolia vägede üle. 1951. aasta tulekahju tõttu säilisid vaid mõned Drukgyal Dzongi reliikviad, näiteks Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyali pilt. Pärast tulekahju säilitati ja kaitsti kindlust, ning sellest on saanud üks Bhutani märkimisväärsemaid vaatamisväärsuseid.
mt: Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper Paro district (Phondey village). It is said that in 1649 Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel built the fortress to commemorate his victory over the Tibetan-Mongolian forces. A 1951 fire destroyed most of the Drukgyal Dzong relics, including a picture of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, and it has become one of Bhutan's most notable tourist attractions.
ref: The Drukgyal Dzong is a ruined fortress and Buddhist monastery in the upper part of the Paro District (in Phondey Village). It is said that in 1649, Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyel created the fortress to commemorate his victory against the Tibetan-Mongol forces. In 1951, a fire caused for only some of the relics of the Drukgyal Dzong to remain, such as the image of Zhabdrung Ngawang Namgyal. After the fire, the fortress was preserved and protected, remaining to be one of Bhutan's most sensational attractions.

src: 18. sajandil oli Kambodža kahe võimsa naabri Tai ja Vietnami vahele pigistatud. Tailased tungisid 18. sajandil korduvalt Kambodžasse ning hävitasid 1772. aastal Phnom Pheni. 18. sajandi lõpuaastatel tungisid vietnamlased ka Kambodžasse.
mt: 18th century, Cambodia was squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and destroyed Phnom Penh in 1772. In the late 18th century, Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.
ref: During the 18th century Cambodia found itself squeezed between two powerful neighbors, Thailand and Vietnam. The Thais invaded Cambodia several times in the 18th century and in 1772 they destroyed Phnom Phen. In the last years of the 18th century the Vietnamese also invaded Cambodia.

src: Taiwani mainiti juba 15. sajandil, mil mööda seilavad Euroopa meremehed kirjutasid saare nime üles kui Ilha Formosa ehk „ilus saar”. 1624. aastal asutas Hollandi Ida-India Kompanii edela Taiwanis baasi, algatades ümberkujundamise põlisrahvaste teraviljatootmise tavades ja palgates Hiina töölisi riisi- ja suhkruistandustesse tööle. 1683. aastal võtsid Qingi dünastia (1644-1912) jõud Taiwani lääne- ja põhjapoolsed rannikualad oma võimu alla ja kuulutasid Taiwani 1885. aastal Qingi Impeeriumi provintsiks. 1895. aastal, pärast esimeses Hiina-Jaapani (1894–1895) sõjas lüüasaamist, allkirjastas Qingi dünastia valitsus Shimonoseki rahulepingu, millega andis Taiwani valitsemisõiguse üle Jaapanile, mis valitses saart kuni 1945. aastani.
mt: Taiwan was mentioned as early as the 15th century, when sailing Europeans wrote down the name of the island as Ilha Formosa, or "beautiful island". In 1624, the Dutch East India Company established a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a reformation of the native tribes' agricultural practices and hiring Chinese workers to work in rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, the Qing dynasty (1644-1912) took control of Taiwan's western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after losing the First Sino-Japanese War (1894–1895), the Qing dynasty government signed the Treaty of Shimonoseki, which ceded Taiwan's administration to Japan, which ruled the island until 1945.
ref: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island. In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations. In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885. In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.

src: Seda nimetatakse kemikaali pH-ks. Saad teha endale indikaatori punase peakapsa mahlaga. Kapsamahl muudab värvi olenevalt sellest, kui happeline või aluseline (leeliseline) see kemikaal on. pH-taset näitab uuritud kemikaalis olev vesinikioonide (H tähistabki pH-s vesinikku) hulk. Vesinikioonid on prootonid, mille küljest on elektronid eemaldatud (kuna vesiniku aatomid koosnevad ühest prootonist ja ühest elektronist).
mt: This is called the pH. You can make yourself an indicator with red cabbage juice. The color of the juice changes depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the substance is. The pH of a substance is the amount of hydrogen ions (H represents pH) in the substance. Hydrogen ions are protons, from which electrons have been removed (since hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
ref: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice. The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is. The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical. Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).

src: Lõvid on kõige sotsiaalsemad kaslased, elades suurtes rühmades, ehk praidides. Karjad koosnevad ühest kuni kolmest suguluses olevast täiskasvanud isasest ja kuni kolmekümnest emasest ja kutsikast. Emased on tavaliselt omavahel väga tihedalt seotud, moodustades suure õdedest ja tütardest koosneva perekonna. Lõvikarjad käituvad paljuski hundi- ja koerakarjade moodi – loomad, kes on lõvidega (kuid mitte teiste suurte kaslastega) üllatavalt sarnased ning on samuti oma saakloomadele väga surmavad.
mt: Lions are the most social of the big cats, living in prides. Prides consist of one to three related adult males and up to 30 females and cubs. Females are typically very closely related, forming a family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides behave much like leopard and wolf packs – animals that are surprisingly similar to lions and are also very deadly to their prey.
ref: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides. Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs. The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters. Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.

src: Nendest madalamal astmel on keskmise suurusega kaslased, kelle toiduks on keskmise suurusega saakloomad, alustades jänestega ning lõpetades antiloopide ja kitsedega. Viimaseks on olemas palju väikeseid kaslasi (sh hulkuvad kodukassid), kes söövad tunduvalt rohkem väikeseid saakloomi, nagu putukad, närilised, sisalikud ja linnud. Nende edu saladuseks on niši kontseptsioon, konkreetne töö, mida iga kass teeb, mis hoiab teda teistega võistlemast.
mt: At the lowest level are the average-sized cats, whose food is the average-sized prey, starting with rabbits and ending with antelopes and rodents. The last are many small cats (including the domestic cat), who eat much smaller prey, such as insects, reptiles, rodents and birds. Their secret of success is the niche concept, a specific job that each cat does, which keeps it from competing with others.
ref: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer. Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.

src: Nendest madalamal astmel on keskmise suurusega kaslased, kelle toiduks on keskmise suurusega saakloomad, alustades jänestega ning lõpetades antiloopide ja kitsedega. Viimaseks on olemas palju väikeseid kaslasi (sh hulkuvad kodukassid), kes söövad tunduvalt rohkem väikeseid saakloomi, nagu putukad, närilised, sisalikud ja linnud. Nende edu saladuseks on niši kontseptsioon, konkreetne töö, mida iga kass teeb, mis hoiab teda teistega võistlemast.

Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds. src: Otselottidele meeldib süüa väikeloomi. Nad püüavad võimaluse korral ahve, madusid, närilisi ja linde. Pea kõik loomadest, kellele otselot jahti peab, on temast oluliselt väiksemad. Teadlaste arvates jälitavad ja leiavad otselotid saakloomi (ohvreid) lõhna järgi, nuusutades kohti, kus nad viibinud on. Nende pimedas nägemise võime on suurepärane, ka liiguvad väga vargsi. Otselot sulandub saakloomade jahtimiseks ümbritsevasse keskkonda ning kargab siis saagile peale.
mt: Predators like to eat small animals. They try to catch hares, rabbits, rodents and birds. Almost all animals they hunt are much smaller than them. Scientists believe that predators track and find prey by smell, sniffing places where they have been. Their night vision is excellent, and they move very stealthily. A predator blends into its surroundings to hunt prey and then pounces.
ref: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is. Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground. They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.

src: Tiiger, mitmekülgne sportlane, suudab ronida (kuigi mitte hästi), ujuda, ületada hüpates suuri vahemaid ja tõmmata viis korda tugevama jõuga kui tugev inimene. Tiiger kuulub samasse rühma (Genus Panthera) nagu lõvid, leopardid ja jaaguarid. Ainult need neli kaslast oskavad möirata. Tiigri möire ei nagu lõvi valjuhäälne möire, vaid pigem lause lõrisevalt karjutud sõnadest.
mt: The tiger, a versatile athlete, can climb (although not well), swim, leap over great distances, and pull five times the weight of a man. The tiger belongs to the same genus (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. Only these four species can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the lion's loud roar, but rather a sentence spoken in a hiss of words.
ref: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human. The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar. The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.

src: Rakk on elus(olendite) organismi väikseim struktuurne ja funktsionaalne üksus. Sõna cell ('rakk') tuleb ladinakeelsest sõnast cella, mis tähendab väikest ruumi. Kui vaatate elusorganisme mikroskoobi all, näete, et need on koosnevad väikestest ruutudest või kuulidest. Inglismaalt pärit bioloog Robert Hooke nägi mikroskoobi abil korgis väikeseid ruute. Need nägid välja nagu toad. Ta oli esimene inimene, kes vaatles surnud rakke.
mt: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of an organism. The word cell comes from the Latin cellula, meaning "small room". When viewed under a microscope, cells appear either as a single, small, round object (like a bubble) or as a very small, flat, round object (like a plate). In 1665, Englishman Robert Hooke looked at a piece of cork under a microscope. He saw small, round objects that looked like the rooms in a monastery. He was the first person to look at dead cells.
ref: A cell is the smallest structural and functional unit of a living (things) organism. Cell comes from the Latin word cella which means small room. If you look at living things under a microscope, you will see that they are made of small squares or balls. Robert Hooke, a biologist from England, saw small squares in cork with a microscope. They looked like rooms. He was the first person to observe dead cells

src: Loomad koosnevad paljudest rakkudest. Nad söövad asju ja seedivad neid. Enamik loomadest saavad liikuda. Ainult loomadel on ajud (kuid isegi mitte kõikidel loomadel; näiteks pole ajusid meduusidel). Loomi võib leida kõikjalt üle maailma. nad kaevavad maa sees, ujuvad ookeanides ja lendavad taevas.
mt: Animals are made up of many cells. They eat things and digest them. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (but not all animals; for example, there are no brains in jellyfish). Animals can be found all over the world. they dig in the ground, swim in the oceans and fly in the sky.
ref: Animals are made of many cells. They eat things and digest them inside. Most animals can move. Only animals have brains (though not even all animals do; jellyfish, for example, do not have brains). Animals are found all over the earth. They dig in the ground, swim in the oceans, and fly in the sky.

src: Taimed toodavad hapnikku, mida inimesed hingavad, ja neelavad süsihappegaasi, mida inimesed välja hingavad. Taimed valmistavad endale fotosünteesi abil päikesest toitu. Samuti annavad nad varju. Me teeme oma majad taimedest ja valmistame riideid taimedest. Enamik toite, mida me sööme, on taimedest. Taimedeta ei suudaks loomad ellu jääda.
mt: Plants produce oxygen, which humans inhale, and absorb carbon dioxide, which humans exhale. Plants make food from sunlight using photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We build our homes from plants and make clothes from plants. Most of the food we eat is from plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
ref: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out). Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade. We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.

src: Kui väike rühm elusolendeid (väike populatsioon) eraldub peamisest populatsioonist, kust nad pärinevad (näiteks liiguvad nad üle mäeaheliku või jõe või kolivad uuele saarele, ja tagasi tulemine ei ole lihtne), satuvad nad sageli varasemast erinevasse keskkonda. Uues keskkonnas on teistsugused ressursid ja teistsugused konkurendid, seega vajab uus populatsioon varasemalt vajalikest erinevaid omadusi ja peab kohanduma, et olla tugev konkurent. Algne populatsioon ei ole üldse muutunud, nad vajavad endiselt samu kohandusi kui varem. Aja möödudes, kui uus populatsioon kohaneb oma uue keskkonnaga, näevad nad üha vähem välja teise populatsiooni moodi. Lõpptulemusena, tuhandete või isegi miljonite aastate pärast, näevad kaks populatsiooni välja nii erinevad, et neid ei saa nimetada samadeks liikideks. Nimetame seda protsessi liigitekkeks, mis tähendab lihtsalt uue liigi väljakujunemist. Liigiteke on evolutsiooni vältimatu tagajärg ja selle väga tähtis osa.
mt: When a small group of organisms (a small population) separates from the main population (for example, they move over a mountain range or a river or move to a new island, and returning is not easy), they often end up in a different environment. In the new environment, there are different resources and different competitors, so the new population needs different traits and must adapt to be a strong competitor. The original population has not changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population adapts to its new environment, they look less and less like the other population. In the end, after thousands or even millions of years, two populations look so different that they cannot be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which simply means the creation of a new species. Speciation is an inevitable consequence of evolution and a very important part of it.
ref: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before. This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before. The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before. Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population. Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species. We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.

src: Vereringesüsteemi suurim elund on süda, mis pumpab verd. Veri väljub südamest veresoonte kaudu, mida nimetatakse arteriteks ja suundub tagasi südamesse veresoonte kaudu, mida nimetatakse veenideks. Väikseimaid veresooni nimetatakse kapillaarideks.
mt: The largest organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood leaves the heart through arteries, and returns to the heart through veins. The smallest blood vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Vereringesüsteemi suurim elund on süda, mis pumpab verd. Veri väljub südamest veresoonte kaudu, mida nimetatakse arteriteks ja suundub tagasi südamesse veresoonte kaudu, mida nimetatakse veenideks. Väikseimaid veresooni nimetatakse kapillaarideks.
mt: The largest organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps blood. Blood leaves the heart through arteries, and returns to the heart through veins. The smallest blood vessels are called capillaries.
ref: The major organ of the circulatory system is the heart, which pumps the blood. Blood goes away from the heart in tubes called arteries and comes back to the heart in tubes called veins. The smallest tubes are called capillaries.

src: Putukad olid esimesed loomad, kes hakkasid õhu abil liikuma. Nende võime lennata aitas neil vaenlasi palju hõlpsamini vältida ja leida toitu ning kaaslast palju tõhusamalt. Enamik putukaid on võimelised oma tiibu keha vastu voltima. See annab neile rohkem võimalusi leida kiskjate eest peitu pugemiseks väikeseid kohti. Tänapäeval on ainsad putukad, kes pole võimelised oma tiibasid tahapoole pöörama, kiilid ja ühepäevaliblikad.
mt: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them avoid predators and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects are able to flex their wings back against their body. This gives them more options to find small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that are unable to flex their wings forward are butterflies and moths.
ref: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently. Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body. This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators. Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.

src: Putukad olid esimesed loomad, kes hakkasid õhu abil liikuma. Nende võime lennata aitas neil vaenlasi palju hõlpsamini vältida ja leida toitu ning kaaslast palju tõhusamalt. src: Paljud tänapäeva paleontoloogid usuvad, et üks dinosauruste rühm on tänaseni ellu jäänud. Me nimetame neid lindudeks. Paljud inimesed ei pea neid dinosaurusteks, sest neil on suled ja nad suudavad lennata. Kuid lindudel on veel mitu omadust, mis dinosauruse moodi välja näevad. Neil on soomuste ja küünistega jalad, nad munevad mune ning kõnnivad kahel tagajalal nagu T-Rex.
mt: Many modern paleontologists believe that one group of dinosaurs has survived to the present day. We call them birds. Many people do not consider them dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But birds still have many characteristics that look like dinosaurs. They have claws and talons on their feet, they lay eggs and walk on two hind legs like the T-Rex.
ref: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds. Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly. But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Paljud tänapäeva paleontoloogid usuvad, et üks dinosauruste rühm on tänaseni ellu jäänud. Me nimetame neid lindudeks. They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.

src: Tritseeratopsi hambad oleksid suutnud purustada mitte ainult lehti, vaid isegi ka väga kõvasid oksi ja juuri. Mõned teadlased arvavad, et tritseeratopsid sõid palmlehikuid, kriidiajastule tavapärast taimeliiki. Need taimed näevad välja nagu väikesed palmipuud, mille teravad okkalised lehed moodustavad justkui krooni. Enne tüve söömist võis triitseratops kasutada oma tugevat nokka sellelt lehtede eemaldamiseks. Teised teadlased väidavad, et need taimed on väga mürgised, seega on ebatõenäoline, et mõni dinosaurus neid sõi, isegi kui tänapäeval võivad laiskloom ja muud loomad, nagu papagoi (dinosauruse järeltulija), süüa mürgiseid lehti või vilju.
mt: The teeth of the triceratops would have been able to crush not only leaves, but also very hard branches and roots. Some scientists believe that triceratopses ate palm leaves, a typical plant of the Cretaceous period. These plants look like small palm trees, whose hard, leafy leaves form a crown. Before eating the trunk, the triceratops may have used its strong beak to remove these leaves. Other scientists say that these plants are very poisonous, so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today, the sloth and other animals, such as the parrot (a dinosaur descendant), eat poisonous leaves or fruits.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Tritseeratopsi hambad oleksid suutnud purustada mitte ainult lehti, vaid isegi ka väga kõvasid oksi ja juuri. Mõned teadlased arvavad, et tritseeratopsid sõid palmlehikuid, kriidiajastule tavapärast taimeliiki. Need taimed näevad välja nagu väikesed palmipuud, mille teravad okkalised lehed moodustavad justkui krooni. Enne tüve söömist võis triitseratops kasutada oma tugevat nokka sellelt lehtede eemaldamiseks. Teised teadlased väidavad, et need taimed on väga mürgised, seega on ebatõenäoline, et mõni dinosaurus neid sõi, isegi kui tänapäeval võivad laiskloom ja muud loomad, nagu papagoi (dinosauruse järeltulija), süüa mürgiseid lehti või vilju.
mt: The teeth of the triceratops would have been able to crush not only leaves, but also very hard branches and roots. Some scientists believe that triceratopses ate palm leaves, a typical plant of the Cretaceous period. These plants look like small palm trees, whose hard, leafy leaves form a crown. Before eating the trunk, the triceratops may have used its strong beak to remove these leaves. Other scientists say that these plants are very poisonous, so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today, the sloth and other animals, such as the parrot (a dinosaur descendant), eat poisonous leaves or fruits.
ref: A triceratops' teeth would have been able to crush not only leaves but even very tough branches and roots. Some scientists think Triceratops ate cycads, which are a type of plant that was common in the Cretaceous. These plants look like a small palm tree with a crown of sharp, spiky leaves. A Triceratops could have used its strong beak to strip off the leaves before eating the trunk. Other scientists argue that these plants are very poisonous so it is unlikely that any dinosaur ate them, even though today the sloth and other animals like the parrot (a descendant of the dinosaurs) can eat poisonous leaves or fruit.

src: Itaalia riiklik jalgpallimeeskond on Saksa riikliku jalgpallimeeskonna kõrval kõige edukam meeskond maailmas ja nad võitsid 2006. aasta FIFA maailmameistrivõistlused. Populaarsete spordialade hulka kuuluvad jalgpall, korvpall, võrkpall, veepall, vehklemine, ragbi, jalgrattasõit, jäähoki, rulluisuhoki ja F1-autovõidusõit. Talisport on kõige populaarsem põhjapoolsetes piirkondades ja itaallased võistlevad sellel alal rahvusvahelistel ja Olümpiamängudel.
mt: Italy's national football team is the most successful team in the world alongside Germany and won the 2006 FIFA World Cup. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and Formula One. Winter sports are the most popular in the northern regions and Italians compete in these on the international and Olympic level.
ref: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006. Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing. Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.

src: Luksemburgil on pikk ajalugu, kuid iseseisvaks sai see 1839. aastal. Tänapäeva Belgia osad kuulusid ajalooliselt Luksemburgi koosseisu, kuid pärast 1830ndate aastate Belgia revolutsiooni läksid need Belgia kätte. Luksemburg on alati püüdnud jääda neutraalseks riigiks, kuid Saksamaa okupeeris selle nii esimeses kui ka teises maailmasõjas. 1957. aastal sai Luksemburg tänapäeval Euroopa Liiduna tuntud organisatsiooni asutajaliikmeks.
mt: Luxembourg has a long history, but it became independent in 1839. The Belgian parts of today's Belgium were historically part of Luxembourg, but after the Belgian Revolution of the 1830s, they went to Belgium. Luxembourg has always tried to remain neutral, but Germany occupied it both in the First and Second World Wars. In 1957, Luxembourg became one of the founding members of the European Union, as it is known today.
ref: Luxembourg has a long history but its independence dates from 1839. Present-day parts of Belgium were part of Luxembourg in the past but became Belgian after the 1830s Belgian Revolution. Luxembourg has always tried to remain a neutral country but it was occupied in both World War I and World War II by Germany. In 1957 Luxembourg became a founding member of the organization which is today known as the European Union.

src: Euroopa Türgi (Ida-Traakia või Rumelia Balkani poolsaarel) hõlmab 3% riigist. Türgi territoorium on üle 1600 kilomeetri (1000 miili) pikk ja 800 km (500 miili) lai ning umbes ristkülikukujuline. Koos järvedega hõlmab Türgi pindala 783 562 ruutkilomeetrit (300 948 ruutmiili), millest 755 688 ruutkilomeetrit (291 773 ruutmiili) on Edela-Aasias ja 23 764 ruutkilomeetrit (9 174 ruutmiili) Euroopas. Türgi on pindalalt maailma 37. suurim riik ja see on umbes sama suur kui Prantsusmaa suurlinnad ja Ühendkuningriik kokku panduna. Türgit ümbritseb meri kolmest küljest: läänes on Egeuse meri, põhjas Must meri ja lõunas Vahemeri.
mt: 3% of the country is in Europe (Eastern Thrace or the Balkan Peninsula). The territory of Turkey is over 1600 kilometres (1000 miles) long and 800 km (500 miles) wide and is roughly rectangular in shape. Including lakes, Turkey covers 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 square miles), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 square miles) are in South Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 square miles) in Europe. Turkey is the 37th largest country in the world and is about the same size as the combined area of the French capital cities and the United Kingdom. Turkey is surrounded by sea on three sides: the west is the Aegean Sea, the north is the Black Sea and the south is the Mediterranean Sea.
ref: European Turkey (eastern Thrace or Rumelia in the Balkan peninsula) includes 3% of the country. The territory of Turkey is more than 1,600 kilometres (1,000 mi) long and 800 km (500 mi) wide, with a roughly rectangular shape. Turkey's area, including lakes, occupies 783,562 square kilometres (300,948 sq mi), of which 755,688 square kilometres (291,773 sq mi) are in south west Asia and 23,764 square kilometres (9,174 sq mi) in Europe. Turkey's area makes it the world's 37th-largest country, and is about the size of Metropolitan France and the United Kingdom combined. Turkey is encircled by seas on three sides: the Aegean Sea to the west, the Black Sea to the north and the Mediterranean Sea to the south.

src: Vatikani rahvaarv on umbes 800 inimest. See on väikseim iseseisev riik maailmas ja väikseima rahvaarvuga riik. Vatikan kasutab seadusloomes ja ametlikus suhtluses itaalia keelt. Itaalia keel on ka igapäevane keel, mida kasutab enamik riigis töötavaid inimesi, samas kui ladina keelt kasutatakse usutalitustel. Kõik Vatikani kodanikud on roomakatoliiklased.
mt: Vatican has a population of about 800 people. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the smallest population. Vatican uses Italian in legislation and official communication. Italian is the everyday language, used by most of the people working in the country, while Latin is used in religious services. All Vatican citizens are Roman Catholics.
ref: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population. Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications. Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies. All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.

src: Tänapäeval kasutatake arvuteid piltide ja videote töötlemiseks. Arvutitega saab luua keerulisi animatsioone, ja selliseid animatsioone kasutatakse üha rohkem televisioonis ning filmides. Muusikat salvestatakse tihtipeale keerukate arvutitega, mis heli töötlevad ja kokku miksivad.
mt: Today computers are used to process images and videos. With computers you can create complex animations, and such animations are used more and more in television and movies. Music is often recorded with complex computers that process and mix audio.
ref: Computers today are used to manipulate pictures and videos. Sophisticated animations can be constructed on computers, and this kind of animation is increasingly being used in television and films. Music is often recorded using sophisticated computers to process and mix sounds together.

src: Harappa ja Mohenjo-daro linnades leidus peaaegu igas majas vesiklosett, mis oli ühendatud keeruka kanalisatsioonisüsteemiga. Kanalisatsioonisüsteemide jäänuseid on leitud Kreetas, Minose kultuuri linnade majades, ja Kreekas Santorinis. Tualetid olid olemas ka Vana-Egiptuses, Pärsias ja Hiinas. Rooma tsivilisatsioonis olid tualetid mõnikord osa avalikest kümblusmajadest, kus olid mehed ja naised segamini.
mt: In the cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro, almost every house had a toilet connected to a complex sewerage system. Sewerage systems have been found in Crete, in the cities of the Minoan culture, and in Santorini, Greece. Toilets were also present in Ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In the Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bathhouses, where men and women were mixed.
ref: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system. Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece. There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.

src: Tänapäevase uisu teral on kaks serva, mille vahel on nõgus tühimik. Need kaks serva tagavad jääl parema haardumise ja seda isegi siis, kui tera on kaldu. Kuna tera alumine osa on veidi kaarjas, siis pöörab tera ühele või teisele poole kaldudes ka jääga kontaktis olev serv. See paneb uisutaja pöörama. Kui kallutada uiske paremale, keerab uisutaja paremale, kui kallutada uiske vasakule, pöördub uisutaja vasakule.
mt: Today's skates have two sides, with a hollow in between. These two sides provide better gliding and even when the skate is tilted, the skate will still glide. Because the bottom of the skate is slightly curved, the skate will turn to one side or the other when in contact with the ice. If the skate is tilted to the right, the skater will turn to the right, if the skate is tilted to the left, the skater will turn to the left.
ref: The blade on a modern ice skate has a double edge with a concave hollow between them. The two edges allow for a better grasp of the ice, even when tilted. Because the bottom of the blade is slightly curved, as the blade tilts to one side or the other, the edge which is in contact with the ice also curves. This causes the skater to turn. If the skates tilt to the right, the skater turns right, if the skates tilt to the left, the skater turns left.

src: Oma varasemale energiatasemele naasmiseks peavad nad valgusest saadud täiendavast energiast vabanema. Nad teevad seda, kiirates tillukese valgusosakese, mida kutsutakse footoniks. Teadlased nimetavad seda protsessi stimuleeritud kiirguse emissiooniks, kuna aatomeid stimuleerib ere valgus, põhjustades valguse footoni emissiooni, ja valgus on kiirguse tüüp. Järgmisel pildil näidatakse aatomeid kiirgamas footoneid. Muidugi on footonid päriselus palju väiksemad, kui pildil kujutatud. Footonid on isegi väiksemad, kui need asjad, mis aatome moodustavad!
mt: To return to their previous energy state, they must get rid of the extra energy they gained from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny light particle called a photon. Scientists call this process stimulated emission of light, because atoms are stimulated by bright light to emit light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows atoms emitting photons. Of course, photons in real life are much smaller than the atoms that make them up!
ref: "To return to their previous energy level, they must get rid of the extra energy they got from the light. They do this by emitting a tiny particle of light called a ""photon"". Scientists call this process ""stimulated emission of radiation"" because the atoms are stimulated by the bright light, causing the emission of a photon of light, and light is a type of radiation. The next picture shows the atoms emitting photons. Of course, in reality photons are a lot smaller than those in the picture. Photons are even smaller than the stuff that makes up atoms!"

src: Pärast sadu töötunde põleb pirni sees olev hõõgniit lõpuks läbi ja lambipirn enam ei tööta. Seejärel on vaja lambipirn välja vahetada. Lambipirni asendamisel tuleb olla ettevaatlik. Kõigepealt tuleb lambi lüliti välja lülitada või kaabel lahti ühendada. Seda sellepärast, et elekter, mis liigub soklisse, kuhu pirni metallosa sisse istub, võib teile tõsise elektrilöögi anda, kui puudutate sokli sisemust või pirni metallosa, kui see on alles osaliselt soklis.
mt: After many hours of use, the heat element inside the broiler burns out and the broiler no longer works. Then you need to replace the broiler. When replacing the broiler, be careful. First, turn off the broiler switch or disconnect the cable. This is because the electricity that goes to the socket where the metal housing of the broiler is installed can give you a serious electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal housing of the broiler if it is still partially in the socket.
ref: After hundreds of hours of operation the filament in the bulb eventually burns out and the light bulb no longer works. The light bulb then needs replacing. It is necessary to be careful in replacing the light bulb. First, the switch for the light fixture needs to be turned off or the cable disconnected. This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

This is because electricity flowing into the socket where the metallic part of bulb sits can give you a severe electric shock if you touch the inside of the socket or the metal base of the bulb while it is still partly in the socket.

src: Tuumapomm toimib selle põhimõtte järgi, et see võtab energiat selleks, et panna rakutuum kokku paljude prootonite ja neutronitega. Umbes nagu raske käru mäest üles lükkamine. Tuuma uuesti lõhestamine vabastab osa sellest energiast. Mõnel aatomil on ebastabiilne tuum, mis tähendab, et nad kipuvad lagunema väikese müksu peale või spontaanselt.
mt: A nuclear bomb works on the principle of packing a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. It's like pushing a boulder off a mountain. Releasing the energy of the bomb again releases some of that energy. Some atoms have an unstable nucleus, meaning they tend to decay with a small bump or spontaneously.
ref: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons. Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy. Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.

src: Kui helistate kellelegi, kes on tuhandeid miile eemal, kasutate te satelliiti. Kosmoses olev satelliit võtab kõne vastu ja peegeldab selle peaaegu koheselt tagasi. Satelliidi saatis kosmosesse rakett. Teadlased kasutavad teleskoope kosmoses, sest Maa atmosfäär moonutab veidi valgust ja vaadet. Satelliidi või teleskoobi kosmosesse saatmiseks on vaja hiigelsuurt raketti, mis on üle 100 jala kõrgune.
mt: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you use a satellite. The satellite takes the call and reflects it back almost instantaneously. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth's atmosphere distorts light and view a little. Sending a satellite or telescope into space requires a huge rocket that is over 100 feet tall.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Kui helistate kellelegi, kes on tuhandeid miile eemal, kasutate te satelliiti. Kosmoses olev satelliit võtab kõne vastu ja peegeldab selle peaaegu koheselt tagasi. Satelliidi saatis kosmosesse rakett. Teadlased kasutavad teleskoope kosmoses, sest Maa atmosfäär moonutab veidi valgust ja vaadet. Satelliidi või teleskoobi kosmosesse saatmiseks on vaja hiigelsuurt raketti, mis on üle 100 jala kõrgune.
mt: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you use a satellite. The satellite takes the call and reflects it back almost instantaneously. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth's atmosphere distorts light and view a little. Sending a satellite or telescope into space requires a huge rocket that is over 100 feet tall.
ref: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite. The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly. The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view. It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.

src: Aeg on miski, mis on kõikjal meie ümber ja mõjutab kõike, mida teeme, kuid seda on raske mõista. Religiooni-, filosoofia- ja loodusteadlased on aega uurinud tuhandeid aastaid. Me kogeme aega sündmuste jadana, mis möödub tulevikust oleviku kaudu minevikku. Aeg on ka see, kuidas me võrdleme sündmuste kestust (pikkust). Aja möödumist saad ise märgata, kui jälgid mõne tsüklilise sündmuse kordumist. Tsüklilised sündmused on asjad, mis toimuvad korrapäraselt ikka uuesti ja uuesti.
mt: Time is something that is everywhere around us and affects everything we do, but it is hard to understand. Scientists have been studying time for thousands of years. We experience time as a sequence of events, which pass from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration of events. You can see time passing if you watch a cyclic event repeat itself. Cyclic events are things that happen in a regular pattern again and again.
ref: Time is something that is all around us, and affects everything we do, yet is difficult to understand. Time has been studied by religious, philosophical, and scientific scholars for thousands of years. We experience time as a series of events passing from the future through the present to the past. Time is also how we compare the duration (length) of events. You can mark the passing of time yourself by observing the repetition of a cyclical event. A cyclical event is something that happens again and again regularly.

src: Traditsiooni kohaselt pidi troonipärija peale kooli lõpetamist kohe sõjaväeteenistusse asuma. Kuid Charles astus Cambridge'is asuvasse Trinity kolledžisse, kus ta õppis antropoloogiat, arheoloogiat ja hiljem ka ajalugu, saades 2:2 (madalama teise astme kraadi). Charles oli esimene Briti kuningaperekonna liige, kas sai akadeemilise kraadi.
mt: Traditionally, the heir to the throne was expected to go straight into military service after finishing school. However, Charles went to Cambridge's Trinity College, where he studied anthropology, archaeology and later history, receiving a 2:2 (the lowest second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British royal family to receive an academic degree.
ref: Traditionally, the heir to the throne would go straight into the military after finishing school. However, Charles went to university at Trinity College, Cambridge where he studied Anthropology and Archaeology, and later History, earning a 2:2 (a lower second class degree). Charles was the first member of the British Royal Family to be awarded a degree.

src: Inglismaal oli pärast Danelawi vallutamist pikk rahuperiood. 991. aastal aga oli Ethelred silmitsi viikingite laevastikuga, mis oli suurem kui kõik Guthrumi omad sajand tagasi. Seda laevastikku juhtis Olaf Trygvasson, norrakas, kes soovis oma riiki Taani võimu käest tagasi saada. Pärast esialgseid sõjaväelisi tagasilööke õnnestus Ethelredil Olafiga kokkulepe saavutada ja Olaf naases Norrasse, kus üritas vahelduva eduga oma kuningriiki tagasi saada.
mt: 991 AD was a long period of peace after the conquest of Denmark. However, in 991 AD, Ethelred was facing a Viking fleet that was larger than Guthrum's fleet a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian who wanted to regain his country from Danish rule. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to reach an agreement with Olaf and Olaf returned to Norway, where he tried unsuccessfully to regain his kingdom.
ref: England had experienced a long period of peace after the reconquest of the Danelaw. However in 991 Ethelred was faced with a Viking fleet larger than any since Guthrum's a century earlier. This fleet was led by Olaf Trygvasson, a Norwegian with ambitions to reclaim his country from Danish domination. After initial military setbacks, Ethelred was able to agree to terms with Olaf, who returned to Norway to try to gain his kingdom with mixed success.

src: 15. sajandi paiku oli Eesti põhjaosa suuresti Saksamaa kultuuri mõju all. Mõned saksa mungad tahtsid jumalat kohalikule rahvale lähemale tuua, seega leiutasid nad eesti kirjakeele. See põhines Saksa tähestikul ja lisatud oli üks tähemärk, „Õ/õ”. Aja möödudes sulandusid kokku paljud sõnad, mis olid saksa keelest laenatud. See oli valgustusajastu algus.
mt: 15th century, the northern part of Estonia was largely under the influence of German culture. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the local people, so they invented the Estonian written language. It was based on the German alphabet and one additional mark, "Õ/õ". Over time, many words that were borrowed from German were merged. This was the beginning of the Enlightenment.
ref: "Around the 15th century, northern Estonia was under great cultural influence of Germany. Some German monks wanted to bring God closer to the native people, so they invented the Estonian literal language. It was based on the German alphabet and one character ""Õ/õ"" was added. As time passed, many words that were borrowed from German coalesced. This was the beginning of enlightenment."

src: Hindi keelt kõnelevate inimeste arvu kohta on erinevaid prognoose. Hinnanguliselt jääb see maailma teise ja neljanda enamkõneldava keele hulka. Emakeelena kõnelejate arv oleneb sellest, kas arvestatakse ka mitte väga lähedalt seotud dialekte. Hinnanguliselt räägib keelt 340 kuni 500 miljonit inimest ning keelest saab aru koguni 800 miljonit inimest. Hindi ja urdu keele sõnavara on sarnane, kuid kirjapilt erineb; mõlema keele kõnelejad saavad üldjuhul üksteisest argivestlustes aru.
mt: There are various estimates of the number of native speakers of Hindi. It is generally considered to be the second or fourth most spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers depends on whether or not closely related dialects are included. Estimates range from 340 to 500 million native speakers and up to 800 million people who can understand it. The vocabulary of Hindi and Urdu is similar, but the writing systems are different; speakers of the two languages can generally understand each other.
ref: There are varying estimates for how many people speak Hindi. It is estimated to be between the second and fourth most commonly spoken language in the world. The number of native speakers varies depending on whether or not very closely related dialects are counted. Estimates range from 340 million to 500 million speakers, and as many as 800 million people can understand the language. Hindi and Urdu are similar in vocabulary but different in script; in everyday conversations, speakers of both languages can usually understand each other.

src: Hangul on ainuke sihilikult leiutatud igapäevases kasutuses olev tähestik. Tähestik leiutati 1444. aastal Kuningas Sejongi (1418–1450) valitsemisajal. Kuningas Sejong oli Joseoni dünastia neljas kuningas ja ta on üks kõige kõrgemalt hinnatud kuningaid. Algselt nimetas ta hanguli tähestikku Hunmin Jeongeumiks, mis tähendab „õiged helid rahva juhendamiseks”.
mt: Hangul is the only alphabet created for everyday use. The alphabet was created in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418–1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded kings. He originally named the Hangul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means "correct sounds for the instruction of the people".
ref: "Hangeul is the only purposely invented alphabet in popular daily use. The alphabet was invented in 1444 during the reign of King Sejong (1418 – 1450). King Sejong was the fourth king of the Joseon Dynasty and is one of the most highly regarded. He originally named the Hangeul alphabet Hunmin Jeongeum, which means ""the correct sounds for the instruction of the people""."

src: Selle kohta, kuidas sanskriti keel tekkis, on palju teooriaid. Üks neist räägib oma keele kaasa toonud aarjalaste rändest läänest Indiasse. Sanskrit on iidne keel ning seda võib võrrelda Euroopas räägitava ladina keelega. Maailma vanim teadaolev raamat oli kirjutatud sanskriti keeles. Upanišadide koostamise järel hääbus sankskriti keel hierarhia tõttu. Sanskrit on väga keerukas ja rikas keel, mis on paljude kaasaegsete India keelte allikaks, just nagu ladina keel on selliste Euroopa keelte allikaks nagu prantsuse keel ja hispaania keel.
mt: There are many theories about how the Sanskrit language came to be. One of them talks about the Aryan migration from the west to India. Sanskrit is an ancient language and can be compared to the Latin language in Europe. The oldest known book was written in Sanskrit. After the Upanishads were compiled, the Sanskrit language became obsolete due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language that is the source of many modern Indian languages, just as Latin is the source of languages such as French and Spanish.
ref: There are many theories to how Sanskrit came into existence. One of them is about an Aryan migration from the west into India who brought their language with them. Sanskrit is an ancient language and is comparable to the Latin language spoken in Europe. The earliest known book in the world was written in Sanskrit. After the compilation of Upanishads, Sanskrit just faded due to hierarchy. Sanskrit is a very complex and rich language, which has served to be the source for many modern Indian languages, just like Latin is the source for European languages like French and Spanish.

src: Kuidas Io gravitatsioon mulle mõjuks? Kui seisaksite Io pinnal, kaaluksite vähem kui Maal. Inimene, kes kaalub Maal 200 naela (90 kg), kaaluks Io'l umbes 36 naela (16 kg). Seega mõjub gravitatsioonijõud sulle muidugi vähem.
mt: How would I be affected by Io's gravity? If you stood on Io's surface, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90 kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16 kg) on Io. So, of course, the gravitational force would affect you less.
ref: How would Io's gravity pull on me? If you stood on the surface of Io, you would weigh less than you do on Earth. A person who weighs 200 pounds (90kg) on Earth would weigh about 36 pounds (16kg) on Io. So the gravity, of course, pulls less on you.

src: Kuu pind koosneb kividest ja tolmust. Kuu välimist kihti kutsutakse koorikuks. Koor on esiküljes umbes 70 km paksune ja tagaküljes 100 km paksune. See on kuumerede all õhem ja mägismaa all paksem. Lähemal küljel võib olla rohkem meresid, sest koorik on õhem. Laaval oli lihtsam pinnale tõusta.
mt: The moon's surface is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer is called the regolith. The regolith is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. Closer to the maria, there is more sea, because the regolith is thinner. It was easier to land on the near side.
ref: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust. The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side. It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands. There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.

src: Mitmed inimesed unistavad päevast, mil nad saavad lennata teise tähe juurde ja avastada teisi maailmaid; mõned soovivad teada, mida seal leida võib; mõned usuvad, et teistel planeetidel võivad elada tulnukad või muud eluvormid. Kuid kui see peaks kunagi juhtuma, ei juhtu see tõenäoliselt pikka aega. Tähed on niivõrd hajutatud, et naabritest planeetide vahel on triljoneid miile. Ehk seisavad teie lapselapselapsed ühel päeval tulnukamaailma tipus ja mõtlevad oma iidsetest eelkäijatest?
mt: Many people dream of the day they can fly to another star and discover other worlds; some want to know what they can find there; some believe that other planets may be inhabited by aliens or other life forms. But if this were to happen, it would not happen for a long time. Stars are so far apart that there are trillions of miles between neighboring planets. So your great-great-grandchildren stand one day on the top of an alien world and think about their ancient ancestors?
ref: "Many people dream of the day when humans can travel to another star and explore other worlds, some people wonder what's out there some belive that aliens or other life may live on another plant. But, if this ever does happen probably won't happen for a very long time. The stars are so spread out that there are trillions of miles between stars that are ""neighbors"". Maybe one day, your great grandchildren will be standing atop an alien world wondering about their ancient ancestors?"

src: Päikesel pole maakoort nagu Maal, mille peal seista saaks. Kogu päike koosneb gaasidest, tulest ja plasmast. Mida kaugemal on gaas Päikese keskosast, seda hõredam see on. Välimist osa, mida me päikest vaadates näeme, nimetatakse fotosfääriks, mis tähendab „valguskera“.
mt: The Sun has no core like Earth, which you could stand on. The Sun is made of gases, fire, and plasma. The gases are farther from the Sun's core, the less dense they are. The outer part, which we see when we look at the Sun, is called the photosphere, which means "light sphere".
ref: "The Sun doesn't have a crust like the Earth that you can stand on. The whole Sun is made out of gases, fire, and plasma. The gas becomes thinner as you go farther from the center of the Sun. The outer-part we see when we look at the Sun is called the photosphere, which means ""ball of light""."

src: Umbes 3000 aastat hiljem, 1610. aastal, kasutas Itaalia astronoom Galileo Galilei teleskoopi, et avastada, et Veenusel on faasid, nagu ka kuul. Faasid tekivad sellepärast, et ainult see pool Veenusest (või Kuust), mis on suunaga Päikese poole, on valgustatud. Veenuse faasid toetasid Copernicuse teooriat, et planeedid tiirlevad ümber Päikese. Paar aastat hiljem 1639. aastal vaatles inglise astronoom Jeremiah Horrocks Veenuse läbimist.
mt: 3000 years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to discover that Venus has phases, like the Moon. Phases occur because only that part of Venus (or the Moon) facing the Sun is illuminated. Venus phases supported Copernicus's theory that planets orbit the Sun. A few years later, in 1639, English astronomer Jeremiah Horrocks observed Venus transit.
ref: About three thousand years later, in 1610, Italian astronomer Galileo Galilei used a telescope to observe that Venus has phases, just as the moon does. Phases happen because only the side of Venus (or of the Moon) facing the Sun is lighted. The phases of Venus supported the theory of Copernicus that the planets go around the Sun. Then, a few years later in 1639, an English astronomer named Jeremiah Horrocks observed a transit of Venus.

src: Amazonase jõgi on maailma teine kõige pikem ja maailma suurim jõgi. Selles voolab kaheksa korda nii palju vett, kui maailma teises suurimas jões. Amazon on ka kõige laiem jõgi maakeral, mis on kohati kuue miili laiune. 20% veest, mis voolab maailma jõgedest ookeanidesse, pärineb Amazonasest. Amazonase peajõgi on 6387 km (3980 miili) pikkune. Sellesse jõuab vesi tuhandetest väiksematest jõgedest.
mt: The Amazon River is the second longest river in the world and the largest river by volume of water. Eight times as much water flows out of the Amazon as out of the second largest river, the Congo in Africa. The Amazon is also the world's widest river on its mouth, which is sometimes six miles wide. Twenty percent of the water that flows into the oceans from the world's rivers comes from the Amazon. The main river of the Amazon is 6387 km (3980 miles) long. It receives water from thousands of smaller rivers.
ref: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river. The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide. A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon. The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.

src: Amazonase jõgi on maailma teine kõige pikem ja maailma suurim jõgi. Selles voolab kaheksa korda nii palju vett, kui maailma teises suurimas jões. Amazon on ka kõige laiem jõgi maakeral, mis on kohati kuue miili laiune. 20% veest, mis voolab maailma jõgedest ookeanidesse, pärineb Amazonasest. Amazonase peajõgi on 6387 km (3980 miili) pikkune. Sellesse jõuab vesi tuhandetest väiksematest jõgedest.

src: Kaheksateist protsenti venezuelalastest on töötud ja enamik neist, kes töötavad, töötavad varimajanduses. Kaks kolmandikku Venezuela töötavast elanikkonnast on tegev teenindussektoris, ligi veerand töötab tööstuses ja viiendik põllumajanduses. Venetsueellaste jaoks on tähtis tööstusharu naftatööstus, mille puhul on riik netoeksportija, kuigi naftatööstuses töötab ainult üks protsent.
mt: 18% of Venezuelans are employed and most of those who are employed are in the informal sector. Two-thirds of Venezuela's working population is in the service sector, about a quarter is in manufacturing and one-fifth is in agriculture. The oil industry is the most important industrial sector for Venezuelans, as the country is a net exporter of oil, although only one percent of Venezuelans work in the oil industry.
ref: Eighteen percent of Venezuelans are unemployed, and most of those who are employed work in the informal economy. Two thirds of Venezuelans who work do so in the service sector, nearly a quarter work in industry and a fifth work in agriculture. An important industry for Venezuelans is oil, where the country is a net exporter, even though only one percent work in the oil industry.

src: Tähed kiirgavad valgust ja soojust energia tõttu, mis vabaneb, kui vesiniku aatomid ühinevad (või sulanduvad), et luua raskemaid elemente. Teadlased töötavad selle kallal, et luua reaktor, mis suudaks energiat toota samal viisil. See on aga väga keeruline probleem, mida lahendada, ja kulub palju aastaid enne, kui näeme valmis ehitatud kasulikke tuumasünteesti reaktoreid.
mt: Stars emit light and heat because of the energy released when hydrogen atoms combine (or fuse) to form heavier elements. Scientists are working on creating a reactor that can produce energy in the same way. This is a very difficult problem to solve, and it will take many years before we see built working nuclear fusion reactors.
ref: Stars give off light and heat because of the energy made when hydrogen atoms are merged (or fused) together to form heavier elements. Scientists are working to create a reactor that can make energy in the same way. This, however, is a very hard problem to solve and will take many years before we see useful fusion reactors built.

src: Elemendid ja ühendid võivad minna ühest olekust teise ja mitte muutuda. Lämmastikul kui gaasil on endiselt samad omadused nagu vedelal lämmastikul. Vedelas olekus on tihedus suurem, kuid molekulid on endiselt samad. Vesi on järjekordne näide. Vee ühend koosneb kahest vesiniku aatomist ja ühest hapniku aatomist. Selle molekulaarne struktuur on sama, olgu tegemist gaasi, vedeliku või tahke ainega. Kuigi selle füüsiline olek võib muutuda, jääb selle keemiline olek samaks.
mt: Elements and compounds can go from one state to another and not change. Lithium as a gas still has the same properties as liquid lithium. In the liquid state, the density is higher, but the molecules are still the same. Water is a good example. The water molecule consists of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. Its molecular structure is the same, whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.
ref: Elements and compounds can move from one state to another and not change. Nitrogen as a gas still has the same properties as liquid nitrogen. The liquid state is denser but the molecules are still the same. Water is another example. The compound water is made up of two hydrogen atoms and one oxygen atom. It has the same molecular structure whether it is a gas, liquid, or solid. Although its physical state may change, its chemical state remains the same.

src: Ameerika Iseseisvussõja ajal moodustasid kolmteist kolooniat konföderatsiooni põhikirja alusel kõigepealt nõrga keskvalitsuse, mille ainsaks osaks oli Kongress. Kongressil polnud võimu, et makse kehtestada, ja kuna puudus riiklik täitev- või kohtuvõim, tugines see kõikide õigusaktide kehtestamisel osariikide võimudele, kes sageli polnud kuigi koostööaltid. Samuti polnud tal volitusi tühistada maksuseadusi ja osariikidevahelisi tariife. Artiklid nõudsid ühehäälset nõusolekut kõigilt osariikidelt, enne kui neid võis muuta, ja osariigid võtsid keskvalitsust nii kergelt, et nende esindajad puudusid sageli.
mt: 13 American colonies formed a confederation under the Articles of Confederation, with a weak central government, whose only organ was Congress. Congress had no power to levy taxes, and since there was no executive or judicial branch, the states often lacked cooperation. It also had no power to repeal taxes and interstate tariffs. Articles required unanimous consent of all states before they could be changed, and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
ref: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation. Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts. It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states. The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.

src: "Kui olete näinud filmi „Rahvuslik aare”, võite arvata, et iseseisvusdeklaratsiooni tagaküljele oli joonistatud aardekaart. Kuid see pole tõsi. Kuigi dokumendi tagaküljele on midagi kirjutatud, ei ole see aardekaart. ""Iseseisvusdeklaratsiooni tagaküljele olid kirjutatud sõnad """"Iseseisvusdeklaratsiooni originaal, kuupäevaga 4. juuli 1776"""". Tekst asub dokumendi alaservas tagurpidi pööratuna."" Kuigi keegi ei tea kindlalt, kes selle kirjutas, on teada, et selle esimestel eluaastatel oli suur pärgamendist dokument (selle mõõdud on 29 ¾  korda 24 ½ tolli) hoiustamiseks rulli keeratud. Nii on tõenäoline, et märge lisati lihtsalt sildina."
mt: "If you have seen the movie "National Treasure", you might think that the back of the Declaration of Independence was a treasure map. But this is not true. Although something was written on the back of the document, it was not a treasure map. ""The original Declaration of Independence, dated July 4, 1776"" was written on the back of the document in reverse."" Although no one knows for sure who wrote this, it is known that this large document (its dimensions are 29 ¾  times 24 ½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So it is likely that the note was added as a label."
ref: "If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence. However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map. Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words ""Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776"". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down. While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage. So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label."

src: Riigi iseseisvuse alguspäevadel aitasid Singapuri botaanikaaia eksperdid saare troopiliseks aialinnaks muuta. 1981. aastal valiti riigi rahvuslilleks hübriidorhidee Vanda Miss Joaquim.
mt: On the island's independence day, Singapore's botanic garden experts helped turn the island into a tropical garden city. In 1981, the hybrid orchid Vanda Miss Joaquim was chosen as the national flower.
ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

ref: Early in the nation's independence, Singapore Botanic Gardens' expertise helped to transform the island into a tropical Garden City. In 1981, Vanda Miss Joaquim, an orchid hybrid, was chosen as the nation's national flower.

src: Kuigi püramiidide ehitamine kivist jätkus kuni vana kuningriigi lõpuni, ei ületanud miski Giza püramiidide suurust ega nende konstruktsiooni tehnilisi teadmisi. Uue riigi vanad egiptlased imetlesid oma eellaste mälestusmärke, mis olid siis tublisti üle tuhande aasta vanad.
mt: While the construction of pyramids from stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, nothing surpassed the size of the pyramids of Giza or their technical knowledge of construction. The Old Kingdom's new Egyptians admired the monuments of their predecessors, which were then over a thousand years old.
ref: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction. New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.

src: Igal aastal rändavad oktoobri paiku umbes 1,5 miljonit rohusööjat vihmade tõttu põhjapoolsetest mägedest lõunapoolsetele aladele, ületades Mara jõe. Ja siis tagasi põhja poole lääne kaudu, ületades taas Mara jõe pärast aprillikuu vihmasid. Serengeti piirkond hõlmab Serengeti rahvusparki, Ngorongoro looduskaitseala ja Maswa kaitseala Tansaanias ning Maasai Mara loodusreservaati Keenias.
mt: 1.5 million wildebeest migrate south from the northern mountains to the southern plains in October due to the rains, crossing the Mara River. Then back north, crossing the Mara again in April after the rains. The Serengeti region includes the Serengeti National Park, Ngorongoro Conservation Area, and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara Game Reserve in Kenya.
ref: Every year around October nearly 1.5 million herbivores travel towards the southern plains, crossing the Mara River, from the northern hills for the rains. And then back to the north through the west, once again crossing the Mara river, after the rains in around April. The Serengeti region contains the Serengeti National Park, the Ngorongoro Conservation Area and Maswa Game Reserve in Tanzania and the Maasai Mara National Reserve in Kenya.

src: Kui lahing Prantsusmaa üle oli lõppenud, hakkas Saksamaa tegema ettevalmistusi Briti saarte vallutamiseks. Saksamaa pani selle rünnaku koodnimeks „Operatsioon Merilõvi”. Enamik Suurbritannia armee raskerelvastusest ja varustusest oli Dunkirkist evakueerudes kaduma läinud, mistõttu olid väed üsna nõrgad. Kuid kuninglik merevägi oli ikka palju tugevam, kui Saksa merevägi (Kriegsmarine), ja oleks hävitanud iga üle La Manche'i väina saadetud sissetungijate laevastiku. Ometi asusid väga vähesed Briti kuningliku mereväe laevad potentsiaalsete sissetungiteede lähedal, sest admiralid kartsid, et need võivad Saksa õhurünnaku tagajärjel põhjal minna.
mt: When the fighting in France was over, Germany began preparing for the invasion of the British Isles. Germany called this invasion Operation Sealion. Most of the British Army's heavy equipment and supplies had been lost in the evacuation from Dunkirk, so the forces were quite weak. However, the Royal Navy was much stronger than the German Navy (Kriegsmarine), and would have destroyed every ship sent across the Channel. Yet, very few British Royal Navy ships were stationed near potential invasion routes, because the admirals feared that they would be sunk by German air attacks.
ref: With the battle for France over, Germany began to get ready to invade the island of Britain. Germany code-named the attack “Operation Sealion”. Most of the British Army's heavy weapons and supplies had been lost when it evacuated from Dunkirk, so the army was fairly weak. But the Royal Navy was still much stronger than the German Navy (“Kriegsmarine”) and could have destroyed any invasion fleet sent across the English Channel. However, very few Royal Navy ships were based near the likely invasion routes as the admirals were afraid they would be sunk by German air attack.

src: Alustame Itaalia plaanide selgitamisega. Itaalia oli peamiselt Saksamaa ja Jaapani „väike vend”. Nende armee ja merevägi olid nõrgemad, ehkki nad olid just enne sõja algust ehitanud neli uut laeva. Itaalia peaeesmärgid olid Aafrika riigid. Nende riikide hõivamiseks oleksid nad vajanud vägede stardiplatvorme, et väed saaksid üle Vahemere seilata ja Aafrikasse tungida. Seetõttu pidid nad Egiptuses saama lahti Briti baasidest ja laevadest. Nende tegevuse kõrval ei pidanud Itaalia lahingulaevad mitte midagi muud tegema. Võtame nüüd Jaapani. Nagu Suurbritanniagi, oli ka Jaapan saareriik.
mt: We begin with the Italian plans. Italy was primarily the "little brother" of Germany and Japan. Their army and navy were weaker, although they had just before the war began built four new ships. Their main objectives were the African countries. To take over these countries they would have needed staging platforms, so that their troops could sail across the Mediterranean and invade Africa. Therefore they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Their ships would have had to do nothing else. Taking Japan. Like Great Britain, Japan was an island nation.
ref: "Let's start with an explanation about Italy's plans. Italy was mainly the ""little brother"" of Germany and Japan. It had a weaker army and a weaker navy, although they had just built four new ships right before the beginning of the war. Italy's main goals were African countries. To capture those countries, they would need to have a troop launching pad, so as troops could sail across the Mediterranean Sea and invade Africa. For that, they had to get rid of British bases and ships in Egypt. Besides those actions, Italy's battleships were not supposed to do anything else. Now for Japan. Japan was an island country, just like Britain."
